results.title: Mastitus: disease of the udder
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Evelyn Cherry and Lawrence Cherry
results.brief_description: An account of the causes, symptoms, prevention and cure of three types of mastitis in cattle: Acute, chronic and summer. The film illustrates common practices that contribute to the spread of the disease and demonstrates practical tests and treatment. The advantages of veterinary and clinical analysis and treatment are stressed.

results.title: Masters of the Wok
results.brief_description: This program looks at the integral aspect of cooking and eating in the Chinese culture. It looks at the incredible skills that are required to prepare multi-course banquets and it discusses the long training process that must be undertaken in order to become a chef. The program also examines the different types of food that came from different areas of China.

results.title: Masters of the Baroque
results.creator_credit: WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and Channel Four
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Art of the western world”.
Peter Paul Rubens absorbed much of the intensity of religious ecstacy and suffering portrayed by the artists working in Italy during the Counter-Reformation, excelling in the texture of flesh. Another master was Diego de Velazquez, reproducing the texture of costly materials - silks, brocades and velvet. Rembrandt’s work is examined from the perspective of the artist’s self-confidence in his ability to produce master works of art.

results.title: Masters of modern sculpture. 3. New world
results.brief_description: Shows the influence of the European artists who came to New York with the end of World War II. Illustrates how they began to use all types of materials including wood, iron, steel, plastic, stone and plaster. Works include those by David Smith, John Chamberlain, Isamo Noguchi, Claus Oldenburg, and Christo. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Masters of Animation 1
results.creator_credit: Education Film Centre and John Halas
results.brief_description: A survey, recent and past, from Great Britain, Yugoslavia, Japan and Italy. Originally thirteen episodes, now on three videotapes, the animation covered by the series represents the peak achievements of over 7,000 artists from more than 13 countries. The films selected were awarded 8 Oscars, 21 Oscar nominations and 120 International Prizes between them. Rated: G

results.title: Masterpieces from the Louvre: bronze sculptures from France
results.creator_credit: QAG, Nine Network (Australia), Caroline Turner, David Burnett and Bob Mclean
results.brief_description: In 1988, in conjunction with EXPO, a series of bronze sculptures and paintings, considered masterpieces of French art from the 16th-19th centuries, and which are housed at the Louvre, were exhibited at the Queensland Art Gallery. This video is a potted art history from the Renaissance to Rodin. It looks at famous patrons such as Louis XIV, the Sun King; well regarded artists and sculptors of the time; and gives a brief explanation of the key movements in Art History during that time.

results.title: Mastering Your Microwave
results.brief_description: Many new microwave owners experience great frustration when trying to learn the techniques and principles of microwave cooking. They often feel they will never master the art. The “Mastering Your Microwave” video cookbook collection has been produced by international microwave consultant, Joan McDermott, to help overcome these problems. Everyday recipes including roast meats, souffles, vegetables and fish are included on this video. Rated: G
